contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = You Can Be Special Too | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Evil Nine]] | Cover = Youcanbespecialtoo.jpg | Released = 2 August 2004 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Breakbeat]] | Length = 52:49 | Label = [[Marine Parade Records|Marine Parade]] | Producer = Pat Pardy | Last album = | This album = '''''You Can Be Special Too'''''<br/>(2004) | Next album = }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[About.com]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|5|5}}<ref name="About Review">{{Cite web | last = Allison | first = Mike | title = Evil Nine – You Can Be Special Too | publisher = [[About.com]]. The New York Times Company | accessdate = March 6, 2012 | url = http://dancemusic.about.com/od/reviews/fr/EvilNineYouCan.htm}}</ref> | rev2 = [[Allmusic]] | rev2Score = {{Rating|3.5|5}}<ref name="AMG Review">{{Cite web | last = Anderson | first = Rick | title = You Can Be Special Too Review | publisher = [[Allmusic]]. [[All Media Guide]] ([[Rovi Corporation|Rovi]]) | accessdate = March 6, 2012 | url = {{Allmusic|class=album|id=r706237/review|pure_url=yes}}}}</ref> | rev3 = ''[[The Independent]]'' | rev3Score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref name="Independent Review">{{Cite web | last = Gill | first = Andy | title = Album: Evil Nine | work = [[The Independent]] | date = October 8, 2004 | accessdate = March 6, 2012 | url = http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/album-evil-nine-6160264.html}}</ref> | rev4 = [[PopMatters]] | rev4Score = (7/10)<ref name="PopMatters Review">{{Cite web | last = Umile | first = Dominic | title = Evil Nine: You Can Be Special Too | publisher = [[PopMatters]] | date = March 29, 2005 | accessdate = March 6, 2012 | url = http://www.popmatters.com/pm/review/evilnine-youcan}}</ref> }} '''''You Can Be Special Too''''' is the debut album of [[Evil Nine]]. It was released on 2 August 2004 on the [[Marine Parade Records]] label. The album includes four skits that are short tracks containing lots of [[sampling (music)|samples]]. Tracks 12 and 13 are mislabeled on the album. The song "Restless" actually plays during track 13 and "Even the Smells" plays on track 12. It is unknown what order the tracks were meant to appear on the album. The correct times are listed below according to the track name, not number. ==Track listing== # "Crooked" (Featuring [[Aesop Rock]]) – 5:46 # "Devil Stuff" – 4:52 # "Earth" – 4:56 # "You Can Be Special (Skit)" – 0:36 # "We Have the Energy" – 5:16 # "Snack Bar Lounge" – 2:55 # "Help (Skit)" – 0:22 # "Pearl Shot" (Featuring [[Juice Aleem]]) – 5:19 # "You Are Not Through" – 4:48 # "Richard & Jane (Skit)" – 0:30 # "For Lovers Not Fighters" – 4:11 # "Even the Smells" – 2:03 # "Restless" (Featuring Toastie Taylor) – 4:54 # "You Can Be Special 2 (Skit)" – 0:31 # "Hired Goons" – 5:45 ==Samples== The dialogue at the start of track 4 is from the book [[Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:2004 debut albums]] {{2000s-electronic-album-stub}}
